summary: This document is a subpoena issued by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney to Jordana Feldman, the Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program (EVCP), commanding the production of documents related to the program and its claimants. It includes the subpoena form, proof of service instructions, and the full protocol of the EVCP, detailing its purpose, administration, and claims process.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in criminal case 20CR330, whose defense attorney is requesting the subpoena for documents from the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Jordana Feldman
persons.role: Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program

persons.name: Kenneth R. Feinberg
persons.context: Retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to help design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Camille S. Biros
persons.context: Retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to help design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

persons.name: Marci A. Hamilton
persons.context: A professor and sexual abuse expert who may be consulted by the Program Administrator to inform about the dynamics and impact of sexual abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose alleged sexual abuse is the subject of the compensation program established by his estate.

connections.description: Maxwell is accused of assisting Epstein in the procurement of victims for sexual abuse, as referenced in the EVCP protocol regarding eligibility.
Pagliuca is the attorney representing defendant Ghislaine Maxwell in the criminal case, as indicated on the subpoena.
Both were retained by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein to design the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

The Administrator (Feldman) may, at her discretion and with a claimant's consent, consult with Professor Hamilton for expert advice on sexual abuse dynamics.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to EVCP Administrator
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney issues a subpoena to Jordana Feldman, Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, commanding the production of documents related to the program and its claimants.

events.title: EVCP Protocol Established
events.description: The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program Protocol is finalized, outlining the voluntary, independent program to compensate victims of sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York, Courtroom 318, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team subpoenaed the administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program for all materials related to accusers, including claim forms, communications, payments, and releases.
The subpoena is part of criminal case 20CR330 against Ghislaine Maxwell, with a production date set for November 29, 2021.

The Epstein Victims' Compensation Program was established by the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein and administered independently by Jordana Feldman, with design input from Kenneth Feinberg and Camille Biros.
The program protocol explicitly states it is available to victims regardless of when or where they were harmed, and even if their claims are time-barred or they previously settled with Epstein.

The protocol notes that individuals who allegedly assisted Epstein in procuring victims may be eligible for the program if there is a credible basis they acted under duress due to their own sexual abuse by Epstein.
